title: About Me
text:
I am a first-year doctoral student in Health Economics at the University of Basel, Switzerland. My interests lie in data science and the economics of the environment and health.
In my role as a research assistant before starting my PhD, I worked on several exciting research projects. My bachelor’s thesis on the interdependency of electric vehicle ownership and the availability of charging infrastructure in Norway was published in Energy Policy (link). I also participated in a research project on the impact of an opening-and-testing experiment on health outcomes during the COVID-19 pandemic. The resulting paper was published in PLOS ONE (link). During my master’s studies, I developed a deep interest in using machine learning to derive innovative insights that can shed light on complex economic and environmental phenomena.

title: About Me
text:
Education

M.Sc. in Data Science in Business and Economics - Eberhard Karls University of Tübingen, 2024
Semester Abroad - Monash University, Melbourne, 2023
B.Sc. in Business Information Systems - Technical University of Darmstadt, 2021

title: About Me
text:
Work Experience

Research Assistant Social Data Science Labs

Monash University, Aug 2023 – January 2024

Collaborated on research on using daylight satellite imagery to predict economic activity in developing countries with Klaus Ackermann and Paul Raschky
Programmed several neural networks for semantic segmentation. Implemented custom ResNets, EfficientNets and Vision Transformers in TensorFlow from scratch




Student Assistant - Department of Marketing

Eberhard Karls University of Tübingen, Oct 2021 – May 2023

Conducted research on large-scale Scientific Computing using Docker and AWS
Assisted in the preparation of lectures, assignments and seminars. This often involved writing R code and markdown documents
Programmed several solutions in R for administrative automation at the chair




Working Student ServiceNow Development

PlanHorizon GmbH, Apr 2021 – Aug 2022

Prepared and presented solution demonstrators for pre-sales in frontier industries (Pharmaceuticals and Chemistry)
Developed an AI solution for mail categorization in JavaScript on the ServiceNow Now Platform
Created a functional prototype for a ServiceNow ITBM solution in Pharma R&D management. This encompasses additional working experience in html and Angular JS




Student Research Assistant - Department of Macroeconomics

Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz, Sep 2020 – Oct 2021

Co-authored a research paper on the Covid pandemic published in PLOS ONE. Responsible of data management, visualizations and statistical programming in R and Stata
Assisted Prof. Dr. Wälde at the Chair of Macroeconomics with his empirical research
Created lecture slides using R and REST API interfaces

title: About Me
text:
Publications
Public charging infrastructure and electric vehicles in Norway with Johannes Rode published in Energy Policy, 160, 2022 [Dataset and Replication Material]
Is large-scale rapid CoV-2 testing a substitute for lockdowns? with Marc Diederichs, René Glawion, Peter G. Kremsner, Timo Mitze, Gernot J. Müller, Dominik Papies, Klaus Wälde published in PLOS ONE 17(3): e0265207, 2022 [Dataset and Replication Material]
